instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3.3V on <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi, im just a noob with some basic electronics skills trying to find out if my liquid damaged logic board is completely dead or maybe repairable. 

I started to check the power rails and everything seemed fine until I got to <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> which is on 3.3V.

Should I continue to look other things, or this is the point where I need to start replacement logic board?

until now I checked:
- nothing is getting hot, maybe MCP a little
- no fan spinning
- magsafe connector is orange
- smc reset works with a connected keyboard

PP3V42 - 3.4V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.45V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> -  5V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> - 5V
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> - 0V


Sadly, component level board repairs are not easily available here, so I am just trying to find out if its worth the hassle or I just have to buy a new logic board and replace it myself.

Any suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3.3V on <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> which is on 3.3V"
Is that on L7770?
Check correct value for <RESISTOR>R7780</RESISTOR>/81.
If both good, change <CHIP>U7770</CHIP>.
